Pandemic preparedness is about good data and fast response but that comes from trust as much as it does from technical expertise, and it helps when you are as present with communities in their long tail of recovery after a crisis as you are when the next outbreak starts.

Pandemic preparedness isn‚Äôt just check lists and biomedical investments (though these are also critical). It‚Äôs also about understanding and supporting ALL of our communities and the connective tissue that keeps society going, safely and equitably.

We cannot do any current or future pandemic preparedness & response planning without taking whole of society perspective. If we don‚Äôt, we will continue to marginalize those who CAN‚ÄôT stay home. 

We need to provide the resources to keep those safe who can‚Äôt stay home when we do. https://t.co/vJP0fjQf3y
